Model.Milestone

Class Milestone

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Milestone.Milestone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Milestone>, java.util.Comparator<Milestone>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TargetMilestone

    public class Milestone
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<Milestone>, java.lang.Comparable<Milestone>
    Class representing a Milestone object. A milestone is a label given to a bug report, project or subsystem. For a project or subsystem such a milestone represents the progress achieved so far. A milestone is identified by a String value: the milestone ID. Milestones are comparable: e.g. M0.5 smaller than M1.2.1 and M1.2.1 smaller than M1.3.0 Initially all projects and subsystems have the default achieved milestone: M0.

      • isValidMilestoneID

        public boolean isValidMilestoneID(java.lang.String milestoneID)
        Method to determine whether a given milestone ID is a valid milestone ID. Requirements for a valid milestone ID: the milestone ID has to start with a capital letter M. all non-numerical characters have to be dots. between each couple of dots there has to be at least one digit. the last character of the milestone ID has to be a digit. every part of the version number has to be a number in range [0,99].
        Parameters:
        milestoneID - the milestone ID that has to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the milestone ID is valid, false if not.

      • getIDvalue

        public double getIDvalue()
        Method that converts a String value of milestoneID to a double value, representing a numerical value. Layers in the milestone hierarchy are represented by negative powers of base 10, starting at power zero. After every layer, the power count goes down by 2. e.g: M1.0.5 = 1,0005. or M2.6.3 = 2,0603 or M16.43.1 = 16,4301.
        Returns:
        the double value of the milestone ID, based upon the string value.

      • compare

        public int compare(Milestone m1,
                   Milestone m2)
        Method to compare two different milestone objects. Milestones are lexicographically ordered (e.g. M0.5 smaller than M1.2.1 and M1.2.1 smaller than M1.3.0)
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<Milestone>
        Parameters:
        m1 - the first milestone object
        m2 - the second milestone object
        Returns:
        1 if the id value of m1 greater than the id value of m2 0 if the id value of both objects is equal -1 if the id value of m1 greater than the id value of m2
